page.title: 15Transport,Wick
page.content:
The Highland Omnibus Station was opened in 1957.It has a fleet of 18 buses.The station was positioned for convenience beside the Railway Station.The buses are busiest during the school term.Daily four journeys are made south and eleven to Thurso. There is one modern bus with a toilet and a video in it for long journeys.
From Wick Station British Rail offers a train service to the south three times daily.A journey to Inverness takes four hours.This north route proves popular in summer for vistors to John O' Groats.The diesel train has pullman carriages and a buffet car.
